meanings.definition: The branch of botany that deals with the geographical distribution of plants.
meanings.sent1: In phytogeography, scientists explore where different plants grow around the world.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use phytogeography to understand why certain plants thrive in specific regions.
meanings.sent3: The phytogeography class took a field trip to study plant locations, making it a fun learning experience.
meanings.sent4: The map of phytogeography is like a colorful puzzle showing where each plant piece fits.
meanings.sent5: Learning about phytogeography is like discovering a secret map to the plant kingdom.

meanings.definition: The study of the geographic distribution of plants.
meanings.sent1: Phytogeography helps us understand how plants are spread across different areas.
meanings.sent2: Botanists use phytogeography to map out where specific plant species can be found.
meanings.sent3: During the phytogeography lecture, the professor made jokes about plants going on vacations.
meanings.sent4: The concept of phytogeography paints a vivid picture of plants traveling the world.
meanings.sent5: Exploring phytogeography feels like embarking on a plant treasure hunt.
